question_text: The taotie motif, commonly found on Shang and Zhou dynasty ritual bronze vessels, is typically described as a bilaterally symmetrical zoomorphic mask with which distinctive anatomical feature?
correct_answer: A pair of raised eyes and typically no lower jaw
distractors: A pair of closed eyes and a prominently open lower jaw
A single centered eye and symmetrically flared nostrils
A pair of raised horns and typically no upper jaw

question_text: In Chinese painting, xieyi (写意, literally "writing ideas") is a freehand brush style that prioritizes what quality over precise physical likeness of the subject?
correct_answer: Spiritual semblance and the essential character of the subject
distractors: Geometric abstraction and the structural outline of the subject
Decorative color harmony and the surface texture of the subject
Historical narrative accuracy and the contextual setting of the subject

question_text: Gongbi, the meticulous realist technique in Chinese painting, reached its peak of popularity and royal patronage during which period?
correct_answer: Between the Tang and Song dynasties, from the 7th to 13th centuries
distractors: Between the Han and Jin dynasties, from the 3rd to 5th centuries
Between the Yuan and Ming dynasties, from the 13th to 17th centuries
Between the Sui and Tang dynasties, from the 6th to 10th centuries

question_text: How did Southern Song landscape painting differ from Northern Song landscape painting in terms of composition and scope?
correct_answer: Southern Song painters focused on smaller, intimate scenes with sparse backgrounds, rather than the monumental sweeping landscapes of the Northern Song
distractors: Southern Song painters focused on larger, panoramic scenes with dense backgrounds, rather than the restrained minimalist landscapes of the Northern Song
Southern Song painters focused on idealized, mythological scenes with ornate backgrounds, rather than the naturalistic observed landscapes of the Northern Song
Southern Song painters focused on urban, architectural scenes with geometric backgrounds, rather than the mountainous wilderness landscapes of the Northern Song

question_text: The distinctive jade-green color of celadon glaze is produced by a specific chemical transformation during kiln firing. What is this process?
correct_answer: Iron oxide transforms from ferric to ferrous iron ($\text{Fe}_2\text{O}_3 \to \text{FeO}$) during reduction firing
distractors: Copper oxide transforms from cupric to cuprous oxide ($\text{CuO} \to \text{Cu}_2\text{O}$) during reduction firing
Iron oxide transforms from ferrous to ferric iron ($\text{FeO} \to \text{Fe}_2\text{O}_3$) during oxidation firing
Cobalt oxide transforms from cobaltic to cobaltous oxide ($\text{Co}_2\text{O}_3 \to \text{CoO}$) during reduction firing

question_text: Xu Beihong, one of China's "Four Great Academy Presidents," is best known for combining Chinese ink techniques with Western methods learned at which institution?
correct_answer: The Ecole Nationale Superieure des Beaux-Arts in Paris, where he studied oil painting and drawing
distractors: The Royal Academy of Arts in London, where he studied sculpture and printmaking
The Accademia di Belle Arti in Florence, where he studied fresco and watercolor
The Kunstakademie Dusseldorf in Germany, where he studied oil painting and composition
